fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Customer currently has no clear relationship to an Organization on a request. The details of a customer and organization are not clearly present in a request. The action add/remove customer to/from a request has no impact on Organization value in a request.

Current expectation of Organization functionality from [JSDSERVER-4725|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4725] where quoted
{quote}
Adding/Removing users from organizations *affects only who has the right to view requests shared with this organizations.*
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
Looking to expand the functionality of an Organization 
* Where making an update to Reporter will automatically update the Organization details in a request. 
* Separate the details of reporter's organization to specifying from which reporter belongs to
** Example; hover to customer name, show organization details
* Have a new field of "Participant Organization" defining the mass notification sent out to all users in an organization

h3. Why this is important
To give more insights and detailing of the relationship between the customer and its organization.
 
h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Expanding Organization functionality for its relation with Customer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When we create a rule to trigger an *Alert user* as below:
!Screen Shot 2017-06-02 at 11.59.41 AM.png|thumbnail!
Service Desk is actually proceeding with a *mention* operation which means that only Agents or other JIRA-users will have the ability to do so. So if a rule is set to be fired as the user who triggered the rule, it will fail when the user is a customer 

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve our documentations describing this difference
fields.summary: More information about Alert User within Automation rules

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As described in [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver034/setting-up-service-desk-users-875313790.html#Settingupservicedeskusers-limitedInvolveJIRASoftwareorJIRACoreusers], non-agent users are restricted from some operations in service desk projects as follows.

{quote}
||These users can||These users can't||
|* View issues, comments and attachments\\
* Add and delete their own attachments and internal comments\\
* Watch and vote for issues|\\
* Leave comments for customers\\
* View queues, the customer list, or reports\\
* Transition service desk issues\\
* Log work on a service desk issue\\
* Be assigned to a service desk issue|
{quote}

However, there are actually more operations that non-agent users can't do than the ones listed in the above. For example,

* Edit issues
* Manage watcher list

h3. Suggested Solution

All the operations which non-agent users can't do should be listed in [the page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver034/setting-up-service-desk-users-875313790.html#Settingupservicedeskusers-limitedInvolveJIRASoftwareorJIRACoreusers].
It would be better to list the operations based on [the project permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/managing-project-permissions-861253293.html].
fields.summary: Documentation about permissions of collaborators

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When saving SLA edits, in the modal dialog "Save SLA changes" that appears after clicking the save button, the value for calendar under the expanded "Review all changes" section is always "24/7 Calendar (Default)" for the "All remaining issues" item no matter what calendar is chosen.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.3.6
* Service Desk 3.5.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to *Project Settings -> SLAs*
# Select any SLA
# Click the *Edit* button in the top right
# Change the Calendar for the "All remaining issues" item to something other than 24/7
# Click the *Save* button in the top left of the SLA page
# Expand the *Review all changes* section on the *Save SLA changes*
# Observer the Calendar value for the "All remaining issues" item

h3. Expected Results
The Calendar value matches the change you just made

h3. Actual Results
The Calendar value will always show  "24/7 Calendar (Default)"

h3. Notes
The correct value is actually saved, it's just not displayed in the  *Review all changes* section.
fields.summary: Calendar values for "All remaining issues" always shows as "24/7 Calendar (Default)" in review changes when editing SLAs

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

If a Customer only able to access one SD Portal and log in to Confluence, it is actually possible for that Customer to access other SD Project KBs through a Direct URL Link including navigating the space.
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Prepare a JIRA instance that is connected to Confluence with the same User Base.
 # Create two SD Project (SD1 and SD2) and connect it to a Confluence Space each (KB1 and KB2)
 # Both SD projects have permissions set: "Customers who are added to the project"
 # Make sure the option below is enabled when connecting the Spaces:
{code:java}
"All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a Confluence license."{code}

 # Create a Customer that only exists in SD1 and log in as the Customer to SD1 Portal.
 # Search for an Article in KB1 to clarify that it returns a result.
 # Search for an Article in KB2 to clarify that it should not returns anything.
 # Log in to Confluence using the Customer credentials and clarify that there is no other menu beside the Confluence Logo to clarify that the Customer does not have a Confluence License.
 # Open another session and log in to Confluence as an Admin.
 # Access the KB2 space and copy the URL.
 # Back to the Customer session and paste the link

h3. Expected Result:

With the customer is only allowed to access SD1, the connected KB2 will return the "not permitted" error.
h3. Actual Result:

The Customer will access the space and able to navigate around it.
fields.summary: Other SD Projects Knowledge Base are accessible through direct link

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When Agent receives customer's comment in the mailbox. Replying to customer's comment does not create any comment on the ticket. The reason is update event notification to the agent is missing the reply-to field. Therefore mail client chooses from address of the notification for To: field which is outgoing mail (SMTP).

This is explained in [JIRA Service Desk Notification explanation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-service-desk-notification-explaination-829045118.html], agent reply will be handle by the JIRA's Incoming Mail Handler instead of JSD Incoming Mail Handler mailbox.

This issue does not happen when a customer replies as the reply-to field is available.

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create mail handler for JSD project. i.e: incoming@test.com
 # Create outgoing in JIRA i.e: outgoing@test.com
 # Customer leaves a comment on the ticket
 # Agent receives the update from the customer
 # Agent clicks reply, to reply to customer and create comment on the ticket
 # To: field will be replaced by outgoing mail outgoing@test.com and not JSD's mail handler incoming@test.com

h3. Expected Result
Agent's reply should be added as comment on the ticket

h3. Actual Result
Since the reply has sent to outgoing mail handler, no comment will be created
fields.summary: Agent's reply to customer comment via email does not create comment

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a Customer adds an Agent to their request as a participant, that agent is subsequently treated as a Customer for the purposes of triggering SLAs with events like "Comment: for customer"

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a way to restrict Customer's abilities to add Agents as Request Participants, or, treat Customer-added Agents differently in some other way to avoid this problem. 


h3. Workaround 
Ask Agents to manually remove themselves from being a *Request Participant* before acting further in order to have their events be fired/processed as intended.

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When a JIRA project has a similar Request Type in multiple Request type Groups on the page {{Your Project > Project Settings > Request Types}}.

For example: 
||Request Type Group||Request Type||
|Common|Get IT Help|
|Computer|Get IT Help|

JIRA does not show the request Request Type Group hence this makes it difficult if the group was used to categorize things like a department in the View issue screen.

h5. Feature Request

Add a field to show the Request Type Group so that it is easier to identify under which group the ticket in question was raised.

h5. Existing Behavior

There is no field available that shows the value of the Request Type group selected for the request type when creating the issue.

h5. Workaround

Rename the request types adding the group name into the request type.

Use different projects for different departments to ensure that you can know which group the request type comes from for each project.
fields.summary: Show Request Type Group on View Issue Page

h5. Existing Behavior

An Email is sent to the customer once the ticket has been closed with the survey present there and following the voting from the email, the customer is redirected to the customer portal where they are prompted with the CSAT and a text area which they can use to leave a feedback.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If a user A creates an issue and a user B is added as the participant, if user B inherits the issue and is made the reporter but not removed from the request participant field, all attempts to share the issue in question with other users from the customer portal will throw the error seen below:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Steps To Reproduce

# Create an issue as User A in a JIRA Service Desk project.
# Add a user B to the issue as a request participant.
# Modify the reporter field from inside JIRA (as an Agent) setting user B as the reporter.
# As a user go to customer portal and attempt to share the issue with any other user(other than user B)

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would share the issue with the other user entered.

h5. Actual Behavior

JIRA would throw the error thrown in the image above and if you look at the Network tab in the developer console, it would throw an HTTP 500 response.

h5. Workaround

Remove the user B from the request participant field. Also, if you attempt to add the user from within the JIRA UI, it would alert you correctly that the reporter cannot be in the participant field.

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: In portal attempt to share with reporter throws "failed to update request participants field, error"

h3. Expected Results

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello,

Our instance serves our company Internally. We have multiple Service Desks, and different Agents are assigned to those projects in the *Service Desk Team* role in each project.

We would like to be able to set off automated Transitions based on this role, instead of whether or not they are Agents in any project.

Ex:
 * 10 Agents in IT project [Service Desk Team]
 * 100 Agents in total system
 * Currently it is easy to set up automation for 100 Agents, but I don't know a way to set up automation for only the 10 users
fields.summary: Add Service Desk Team to "User" Condition in Automation

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

Currently our [official guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER034/Receiving+requests+by+email] for configuring email channels does not contain the proper troubleshooting guide for investigating what could have gone wrong when an email channel fails to work correctly.

h5. Feature Request

Can [this link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/troubleshooting-jira-service-desk-incoming-mail-790960076.html] be added so that customers have a first place to start the investigation and then narrow down the issue.
fields.summary: Email Channel Documentation Suggestion

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Today, the Attachments field can be removed from the request type form, however, there's a paperclip icon on the Comment field which allows customers to do drag-and-drop or browse for upload and this cannot be configured.

h3. Suggestion
Allow the Attachments field and option to be completely disabled per request type
fields.summary: Disable the Attachments field and customer's ability to upload attachments per request type

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There is currently no way to store additional information about Organizations. It would be useful for organising all the organizations and to keep track of additional information of each organization.

h3. Suggestion
Allow the storage of additional information for organizations. This can be via properties, key value pair, or anything else. These should also be searchable via the Issue Navigator if possible
fields.summary: Property for organizations

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
After an SD project is linked to a Confluence space, users are able see a list of suggested articles based on what they type in the summary when creating a new request. The titles of these suggestions will be truncated. The only way to see the full title would be to click on the link, which will display the entire article 

h3. Suggestion 
Have the full title display without having to click on the link. This can be done via tooltip (eg. hovering cursor over title) or anything else user friendly
fields.summary: Titles of Suggested articles are truncated and not fully shown

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JSD, if affected version field is added to the request type, all the versions defined in project settings will be displayed to the SD customer. It's not possible to limit the versions to "released" or "unreleased" versions.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option when configuring the field in request type to allow user to define which versions should be displayed to the customer.
fields.summary: Allow user to configure to display only released/unreleased versions in the affected version field on customer portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Problem Statement*

Currently JIRA doesn't have the ability to add a comment when an issue key is in the mail body. It would be great that JIRA mail handler able to comment an issue although user didn't specify any issue key in subject.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk Mail handler doesn't add a comment when an issue key in mail body

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When debugging JIRA Service Desk issues it can be helpful to disable 3rd party add-ons to determine if they are triggering the issue.

However, safe mode in JIRA which is typically used for this disables Service Desk as well.  So you must disable 3rd party add-ons manually (very time consuming) rather than use safe mode.

h3. Suggested Solution
Do not disable Service Desk when JIRA is put into safe mode

h3. Workaround
Manually disable 3rd party add-ons when debugging issues.
fields.summary: Do not disable Service Desk in safe mode

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira Service Desk does not appear to have a method to email all Customers at once, short of using the internal [How to send an email to all Jira users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-send-email-to-all-jira-users-776811096.html]. You would need to gather a list of emails of all Customers and send using this method, which isn't very convenient.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a method in Jira Service Desk to send a single email out to all Customers

h3. Why this is important

Soon we will be merging 2 JSD instances into 1. We need to do comms out to our user base on both JSD's of the upcoming merge and the short outage on the cutover day. 

We have added announcements on the Service Desks affected which is fine for users who visit in the week before the merge. 

However I would feel more re-assured if I was able to mail all customers from the Customers section of JSD to reach more customers before the outage. But I can't find any option to email all customers? Or even export all customer email addresses out to csv which would be a workaround.
fields.summary: Send email to all Service Desk Customers

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We would like additional start and stop conditions for SLAs, plus the ability to loop an SLA to immediately start again once the conditions are met.

For example, I would like a start/stop condition for internal comments and the ability for it to immediately start again once an internal comment is added.

This would be to ensure that agents are providing internal updates to tickets on a regular basis, such as every 24 hours. It will help massively with agent queue management.
fields.summary: Additional SLA Start/Stop Conditions and Loops

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition.
From JIRA Service Desk 3.3, now we are able to look at the Automation Audit Log where Agents could review which issue have its condition met or not met towards the selected Automation. But, there is a condition that the Action or Condition is failing where it shows an "!" icon without any details besides it.

h3. Suggested Solution.
We could take the checkmark(/) icon as met and 'x' as not met, '!' is for failing action. Hence, it will be great if there are more details on how it is failing that could help the Agents/Admin identify how it is failing.

h3. Why is it needed:
With just mentioning to the Agents/Admins that it is '!' will lead to them to swim in the logs and configuration including multiple tests until they could confirm that the Action is successful. In which, all of that will take time.

h3. Notes;
In case you are having trouble troubleshooting the failed automation, refer to the KB below:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Automation+Failed+to+Trigger+Actions
fields.summary: Automation Audit Log Descriptive Error

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
Since [JIRA Service Desk 3.2|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-2-x-release-notes-830281732.html], we could configure a transition to be available from the Portal for Customers to perform it. But, there is still possibility that the transition could be misconfigured or having an issue that allows the Customer to not be able to trigger the transition. At such time, an error like below will be shown.

h3. Suggested Solution:
If the error could provide more information about how it fails, it will be great for the Admin. While Customers indeed does not need to know or shown the descriptive/technical error while using the portal, we could hide the error and make it expandable by click. To make it better, automate a creation of a request when such issue happens so the Admin could see it.

h3. Why is it needed:
This will help the Admin to further troubleshoot the issue as the descriptive error could guide them to the right configuration to be checked.
fields.summary: Better Error Message for Failed Customer Transition

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As requested I am raising a new bug ticket in relation with https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59259 which is available on the later versions of JIRA.

h3. Problem

If user disables the inline edit in JIRA core, the settings are not being respected when navigating to JIRA servicedesk Queuess. However, using issue navigator it works as expected.

h3. Environment 

JIRA 7.3.5 and 7.3.6
JSD 3.5 and 3.4.2
fields.summary: Inline edit configuration in JIRA core is not being respected by JIRA Servicedesk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the status of Service Desk Customer invitations is hidden to project admins and agents.  As of 3.3.0 it is possible to resend invitations by adding the customer to the service desk again, but there is not a way to see which users have accepted used the invitations or who has an expired invitation.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an invitation status column to the Service Desk Project -> Customers screen that would show the status of the invitation as well as allows the project admins to resend the invitation email by clicking a button or link. 

h3. Workaround
Currently you can re-add the customer and that will trigger a new invitation to the be sent, but there is simple way to see the invitation status in the UI.
fields.summary: Show status of customer invites and allow UI option to resend invites from Customers page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

Service Desk email channels may get stuck and fail to process any more emails and looking at the email processor and scheduler, you would see that JIRA is still attempting to pull and process emails however no new email are being processed.

Looking at the processing log, it would appear that JIRA has stopped processing emails however when you look at the log proper in particular after setting the incoming mail to _*Debug*_ mode, it would be observed that the JIRA Service Desk mail channels are still trying to pull emails but they MailJobRunner fails because of:

_Invalid charactersencountered in base64 data_.
{code:java}
2017-05-05 03:45:48,228 Caesium-1-3 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.m.incoming.jepp.processor] MailJobRunner Failed
java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to read next message
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.mailitem.streaming.MailItemDTOIterator.next(MailItemDTOIterator.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.mailitem.streaming.MailItemDTOIterator.next(MailItemDTOIterator.java:15)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.processor.MailProcessorWorker.process(MailProcessorWorker.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.processor.MailProcessorService.run(MailProcessorService.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.services.MailProcessorExecutor.run(MailProcessorExecutor.java:30)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.services.AbstractMailExecutor.execute(AbstractMailExecutor.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.services.MailJobRunner.runJob(MailJobRunner.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.launchJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:401)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeClusteredJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:396)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeQueuedJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:349)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:255)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:252)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeNextJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.run(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:34)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.io.IOException: invalid characters encountered in base64 data
	at org.bouncycastle.util.encoders.Base64Encoder.decode(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.mailitem.streaming.MailItemTupleConsumer.decodeChunk(MailItemTupleConsumer.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.mailitem.streaming.MailItemTupleConsumer.consumeRow(MailItemTupleConsumer.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.mailitem.streaming.MailItemDTOIterator.readNextMessageFully(MailItemDTOIterator.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.jira.internal.mail.processor.feature.puller.mailitem.streaming.MailItemDTOIterator.next(MailItemDTOIterator.java:47)
{code}
h5. Environment

This error from all occurrences seems to affect *Microsoft Exchange Server*.
h5. Diagnosis
 # When you view the _processing log_ tab, there would be no sign of JIRA attempting to process any new emails.
 # When you view the log, you would see the error above.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would be able to ignore this email and continue to process other mails rather than having this one email blocking the whole mail channel.
h5. Actual Behavior

JIRA would not be processing any new emails and keep throwing the error mentioned.
h5. Workaround

The problem causing message must be removed in order for the mail processor to process any further mail.
 * If you wish to recover the email content before removal, follow the KB below:
 ** [How to Export The Email From JIRA Email Processor Plugin (JEPP) |https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=728138770]

To remove the message:
 # Identify the ID of the message (mail item) that needs to be removed (see kb article)
 # Remove the mail item from the database:
 ** 
{code:java}
delete from "AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMCHUNK" where "MAIL_ITEM_ID" = <id to delete>;
delete from "AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEM" where "ID" = <id to delete>;
{code}

 ** These commands must be performed in this order.


h5. Alternate Workaround

Delete the JIRA email channel and create it again.

(!) This however would still leave the old emails in the database but JIRA would be processing the emails from the new email channel id.
fields.summary: Invalid characters encountered in base64 data

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver033/managing-service-desk-notifications-861255295.html/#Managingservicedesknotifications-Chooserecipients we list 6 options for the *To* field of customer notification. However not all the options are available for every type of notification. For example, the "Added participants" is only available for "Participant added" notification.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make all the options available for every type of notification.
fields.summary: Make the options listed in JSD documentation for configuration of customer notification available for all type of notification

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If a user deletes an email channel in JIRA and creates a new one, JIRA should delete all references to this email channel in the database. Especially in the MailConnection table and the MailItem table as if there are emails that failed originally, when you remove the email channel, JIRA Service Desk should not persist these emails in the database.

h5. Expected Behavior

Have JIRA Service Desk remove all mails related to this mailchannel with the old id once the channel is removed or  set a new Status other than the ones used by by working mail channels.

h5. Existing Behavior

JIRA would leave all data related to the mail channel that were in the process of being processed the way they were making it difficult to identify without knowing the purged ID and also, it would never process the emails anymore hence there is no reason to actually persist the data from these mail servers.
fields.summary: Deleting An Email Channel Should Remove All Orphaned Emails

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If a user has multiple emails they use for work, if they receive a notification on one of their email services, they should be able to reply to the ticket with another email account they have it they JIRA allows the association of multiple email addresses for the account.

h5. Existing behavior

If the customer replies, a new account would be created in a public portal scenario with a new ticket created as well and there is no way to associate more than one email with a user in the JIRA Service Desk UI.

h5. Feature Request

Allow the addition of more than one email to an account using an Alias feature.

{quote}
The above request is related to [this ticket|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4103] which was marked as done despite the feature requested not being directly addressed by the [ticket it is linked to|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/SDS-23736].

The key request here is *1 User should be able to have more than 1 email address*.
{quote}
fields.summary: Allow Users To Be able to have more than 1 Email Address

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello Atlassian, 

Our customers are requesting the ability to Share requests by choosing individual users that are part of their Customer Group at the request creation page. They find it insufficient to have only Groups and Private to choose from leaving them no option but to choose Private then create the request first and then go to their "Profile" to find their request and then use the Share feature. 

Is it already possible to choose users that are part of a Customer Group at request creation? 

Do you foresee this becoming an option in the future? 

 

Thanks,
fields.summary: Selecting users from a customer group via the portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Service Desk does not remove INBOX label once the email is read and processed in GMAIL. The Email Request is configured to use IMAPS.

The same configuration used for JIRA Mail Handler will have the email removed its INBOX label once the email is read and processed.

!inbox_ex.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the behavior consistent between JIRA Mail handler and Service Desk Mail request by applying the same change on Service Desk too.

h3. Why this is important
This allows users to identify emails that are sent to the Inbox and easily determine if its read and processed or not. 

h3. Workaround 
Have a filter configured in GMAIL to update label after the email is being read.
fields.summary: Service Desk to remove INBOX label once email is read

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We are trying to connect JIRA service desk to Dell Boomi.

Questions:-

      1. Is there a way to connect Boomi API directly to JIRA API.

      2. Is there any way we can send updates from JIRA back to Boomi using fields.

Thanks
fields.summary: JIRA Connection to Boomi

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As an Admin, I like the new Organizations feature in JIRA Service Desk. However, I have thousands of customers who already exist in my database. I have previously used Groups to manage customers, but adding them one by one to Organizations is time consuming.

h3. Suggested Solution

Give Admins the ability to add customers to Organizations by Group. Bonus points: add the ability to specify Organizations based upon filter criteria and a bulk edit as described in [FEEDBACK-67521|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FEEDBACK-67521].

h3. Why this is important

This will empower teams by significantly reducing admin overhead.
 
h3. Workaround

Create a .csv of users by querying the database directly, then copy/paste user names from that into the Add to Organization field.
fields.summary: Bulk add existing customers to organizations

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi Support,

How to share Priority (or others field) to customer through email notification or Portal.

i spend a time search in forum unfortunately didn't find the solution
fields.summary: Share Priority (or others field) to customer through email notification or Portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
I'd like to be able to have recurring Service Desk request automatically created every week or based on any schedule

h3. Suggestion
Allow recurring Service Desk request to be created based on schedule
fields.summary: Auto create recurring request based on schedule

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a Service Desk project "IT Service Desk"
# Create several requests in the project
# Create an Organization called "A"
# Login as a user that has "Service Desk Team" role of Project ISD but, it does not have the JSD license.
# Navigate to Issue Navigator via _Issues > Search for Issues_
# Change to "Advance" search.
# Put the JQL search below:
{code}project = ISD{code}
# The issue coming from ISD projects will be listed.
# Add more condition on the search like below:
{code}project = ISD AND Organizations = "A"{code}

h3. Expected Result:
- No issue will be listed as there is no request raised under the "A" organization.

h3. Actual Result:

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Starting in JIRA Service Desk 3.3, a notification batching functionality was introduced, with it's data kept in the *AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE* database table. 

When over 2000 notifications are generated in a short period of time, they will all be written to this table. When it's time for JIRA to send the notifications, they may encounter the following known issue depending on the database they are using: [JRASERVER-63290 : Queries with large IN clauses that result in SQL Server errors|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63290]. 

The database will throw this error, and the scheduled job will fail, resulting in subsequent reattempts which will send the notifications over and over. This behavior results in the following stack trace in the application logs:

{code}2017-05-03 08:49:22,951 Caesium-1-2 ERROR anonymous     [c.a.scheduler.core.JobLauncher] Scheduled job with ID 'sd.custom.notification.batch.send' failed
com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught SQLException for update "dbo"."AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE"
set "SENT_TIME" = ? where "AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE"."ID" in (?, ?, ?, ...?)
	at com.querydsl.sql.DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.java:50)
	at com.querydsl.sql.Configuration.translate(Configuration.java:453)
	at com.querydsl.sql.dml.SQLUpdateClause.execute(SQLUpdateClause.java:205)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.notifications.internal.dao.NotificationBatchQueueDao.setSendTimeStamp(NotificationBatchQueueDao.java:68)
	Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Prepared or callable statement has more than 2000 parameter markers.
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.SQLParser.parse(SQLParser.java:1254)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.SQLParser.parse(SQLParser.java:165){code}

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk 3.3 and above
* Either of the databases affected by [JRASERVER-63290 : Queries with large IN clauses that result in SQL Server errors|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63290].
** Microsoft SQL Server
** PostgreSQL 

h3. Expected Results

JIRA will only send the notifications once

h3. Actual Results

JIRA will send the notifications repeatedly

h3.Workaround

The logic utilized by the batching job checks the *AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE* table for rows which have a NULL value in the *SENT_TIME* column. Thus, stopping the job will involve either artificially setting the value manually in the database, or removing the rows altogether.

Either of the following will stop the flooding:

*+Fixing SENT_TIME+*

1. Stop JIRA
2. Fill in the AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE.SENT_TIME values with generic date timestamps
3. Start JIRA

*+Deleting the rows+*

1. Stop JIRA
2. Drop all of the rows out of the AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE table where SENT_TIME is NULL
3. Start JIRA
fields.summary: Service Desk notifications send repeatedly when over 2000 notifications are batched

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Since updating to Service Desk 3.3, my customers are changing with whom requests are shared. I want request participants to be managed by my agents only.
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Since Service Desk 3.3, *Request Security* is now called *Customer permissions*
 * In Service Desk 3.2, there was a *Request Security* setting for *Agents only* under *Manage who can add request participants.*
 * That setting is not available under *Customer permissions.*
 * As an admin, I found that setting useful and would like it back.

h3. Why this is important

As a service organization, my team is relied upon by my clients and customers to tightly control request sharing in order to aid ease of reporting and visibility throughout my customers' organizations.
fields.summary: Bring back Agents Only request sharing management on request security/customer permissions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk REST API allows you to add customers to a given service desk but *only if you are a member of the 'Administrators' or 'Service Desk Team' role* for the given project.

If you are not in either of those roles, you won't be able to add customers via REST API, but you will still be able to do so via the UI

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in as an admin user
# Create a Service Desk project
# Create a new user which will be added as a customer to the project
# Make sure your admin user does not have any roles in this project
# Attempt to add the new user as a customer for this Service Desk project via REST API ([{{POST /rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/\{serviceDeskId\}/customer}}|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/server/#servicedeskapi/servicedesk/\{serviceDeskId\}/customer])
# Attempt the same thing via the UI

h3. Expected Results
Both step 5 & 6 should have same results. If you are able to add via the UI, you should be able to add via REST API and vice versa

h3. Actual Results
# You will be able to add the customer via the UI 
# The REST API call will fail 
{code}{
  "errorMessage": "You don't have permission to invite customers to this Service Desk",
  "i18nErrorMessage": {
    "i18nKey": "sd.error.servicedesk.customer.invite.permissions",
    "parameters": []
  }
}{code}

h3. Notes
If you just grant admin user the *Administrators* or *Service Desk Team* role for this project, you will be able to add the customer via REST API

h3.Workaround
Grant the user you are using to perform the REST call the *Administrators* or *Service Desk Team* role for this project
fields.summary: REST API for adding customers inconsistent with UI

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 10 December 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

As a part of [Jira Service Management Data Center 4.21|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagement/jira-service-management-4-21-x-release-notes-1096102630.html#JiraServiceManagement4.21.xreleasenotes-requests] we have released column configuration on the Help center’s request list view. This allows Jira admins to select the columns that they would like to appear in their customer's requests list. It also allows customers to configure and order the columns.

The available fields are type, reference, summary, status, service project, requester, created date, updated date, due date, assignee and priority.

Please refer to our documentation to [learn how to configure the requests list|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/configuring-request-view-1095250690.html].

Kind regards,

Charlie Marriott
Jira Service Management, Data Center & Server
{panel}
Hi, 
I'm new with JIRA and I'm trying to develop a plugin to adding a column to the requests view (list of requests) on customer portal. 
I know there is a production issue already for this problem (here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4580) but I need it now and I would like to understand how to do it with a self-made plugin.
I can't find how I can access this GUI area with JIRA UI Plugin points; here you can find some information about it but the related documentation is VERY POOR: [https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-applications/jira-service-desk/jira-service-desk-ui-plugin-points-customer-portal.|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-applications/jira-service-desk/jira-service-desk-ui-plugin-points-customer-portal./]


Thanks.

When a field or a value is no longer valid as the condition of an Automation rule (they have been renamed), the field or the value has to be updated manually or the rule will not work anymore. 

There's also a warning message shown on the Automation rule page when there's a situation like this. However, this can only be noticed and rectified when a user go to the Automation rule page by coincidence or problem has been reported.
 !warning.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
* the field or value can be automatically updated to the new name

* any other way that can help admin to rectify the problem more proactively

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Pasting screenshots with the same name in the Customer Portal will not display the images correctly.

h3. Steps to reproduce the problem
# Create a new request via Customer Portal.
# Take a screenshot anywhere and paste it to the request by using shortcut key Ctrl + V, example name of the screenshot would be {{image.png}}.
# Take another screenshot and paste it again. The name of the second screenshot might also be {{image.png}}.
# Upload the screenshots.

h3. Expected result
Two different screenshots will be uploaded and displayed

h3. Actual result
Two screenshots are uploaded, however, they look exactly the same in the request. However, the screenshots are uploaded correctly to JIRA and displayed correctly in the JIRA issue

h3. Workaround
Use tools to take screenshots which will give different names to the image. For example, the print screen tool of a MacBook machine will use the timestamp when the image is taken as the name of the file instead of a generic name

h3. Fix suggestion
Allow the user to pick a name for the screen-short at the time of attaching it.
fields.summary: Pasting screenshots with the same name in the Customer Portal results in duplicate image display
